channel.title: regression on Project 3
channel.description: Recent content in regression on Project 3

item.title: Interesting Python Tidbits
item.description: Most of our class has been using R as our main source of coding, but here’s a little bit of Python we’ve recently learned! list1=[1,2,3,4] list1 ## [1, 2, 3, 4] list2=['a','b','c','d'] list2 ## ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd'] list3=list1+list2 list3 ## [1, 2, 3, 4, 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd'] We can also use Reticulate to combine Python and R and have them interact together! library(reticulate) hi<-"Hello" hi="world" print(r.hi,hi) ## Hello world cat(c(hi,py$hi)) ## Hello world While this python code is very remedial, I actually took computer science many years ago in high school and became quite good at the language (at the time!
